text: Xenia is the Ancient Greek concept of hospitality. Xenia means "guest- friendship". It is a bond between the guest and the host. It is marked by gifts from the guest and shelter from the host.Wilson, Nigel Guy (2006). Encyclopedia of Ancient Greece, pp. 370-371; 715. Psychology Press. It plays an important part in Homer's epic poem the Odyssey.Budin, Stephanie Lynn (2004). The Ancient Greeks: New Perspectives, pp. 136-137. ABC-CLIO. ==References== Category:Ancient Greek culture
